_header: This high feast for to magnify
Note: In all three MSS, ends at line 224 with note, ‘Shirley could find no more of this text’.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Procession of Corpus Christi’ — twenty-eight eight-line stanzas (ababbcbc)

CamTCC600.First Lines:
Þis hye feste for to magnefye noweffeste of festes mooste
                    hevenly and devyneIn goostly gladnesse to governe vs and guyeBy which
                    al grace dooþe vppon vs shyne…
CamTCC600.Last Lines:
…Of which god graunt eternal suffysauncewhere aungels sing
                    everlasting Osanna
CamTCC600.Attributed Title:
And nowe here foloweþe an ordenaunce of a processyoune of þe
                    feste of corpus cristi made in london by daun John Lygegate (p. 348, bottom);
                    Procession of Corpus Cristi (RT); Processioun of Corpus Cristi feste by ledegate
                    (RT)
CamTCC600.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 35-43.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
THis high feste for to magnifyeNow fest of festis most hevenly and
                    devyne…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Of whiche god graunt eternal sufficaunceWhere aungels syng
                    euerlastyng Osanna
BLHar2251.Attributed Author:
Processioun of corpus cristi / by lydgate (f. 224v,
                    margin)
BLHar2251.Attributed Title:
Processioun of corpus cristi / by lydgate (f. 224v,
                    margin)
BLHar2251.Editions:
Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.  
             A Selection from the Minor Poems of Don John Lydgate.
Percy Society
         2. London: T. Richard, 1840: 95-103.

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
this hye feste now for to magnefyefeste of festes moste heuenly and
                    deuyne…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…of which god graunte eternall suffysauncewher angelles singe
                    euerlastyng osaunce
BLAdd29729.Note:
At end, to right of last line, scribe writes, ‘Sherleye could fynd
                    no more of thys copye’ (f. 168v).
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
And now here foloweth an ordenaunce of a presesyon of þe feste of
                    corpus cristie made in london by dane Iohn lydgate (f. 166)
